case_title: M/S Habib Modaraba Management (Pvt.) Limited vs Commissioner (Appeals), SRB, Karachi and Assistant Commissioner (Unit-), SRB, Karachi

accussed_details.name: N/A
allegation: Failure to e-file Sales Tax returns

complaint_summary: The appellant challenged the imposition of sales tax on remuneration received for management services provided to Modarabas, arguing that the remuneration constituted profit sharing rather than taxable service charges.
investigation_summary: The Assistant Commissioner concluded that management services provided by Modaraba Management Companies are taxable under tariff heading 9824.0000 of the Sindh Sales Tax on Services Act, 2011. Penalties were imposed for non-payment of sales tax and non-filing of returns. Financial records of M/S First Habib Modaraba for 2011-12 revealed Rs.95,408,940 paid as management fees, covering the tax period from July 2011 to January 2013.
judgment_summary: The court held that Modaraba Management Companies provide taxable management services under tariff heading 9824.0000. It dismissed the appellant's argument that remuneration constituted profit sharing. The appeal was dismissed, upholding the Order-in-Appeal with modifications to penalties.
punishment: Payment of Rs.4,089,409/- as sales tax, Rs.204,470/- penalty for non-payment, and Rs.15,000/- penalty for non-filing of returns.
legal_arguments: Appellant argued remuneration is profit sharing, not service charges.
Appellant claimed no service is provided as Modaraba and Management Company are partners.
Respondent argued remuneration constitutes taxable management services under tariff heading 9824.0000.
Respondent emphasized Modaraba and Management Company are separate legal entities under the Modaraba Ordinance.
statutes: Sindh Sales Tax on Services Act, 2011
Modaraba Companies and Modaraba (Floatation and Control) Ordinance, 1980
sections: Section 44 of Sindh Sales Tax on Services Act, 2011
Section 43(3) of Sindh Sales Tax on Services Act, 2011
Section 43(2) of Sindh Sales Tax on Services Act, 2011
Section 18 of Modaraba Companies and Modaraba Ordinance, 1980
citations: M/S UDL Modaraba Management Company vs Commissioner Appeals, SRB
M/S Habib Safe Deposit Vault (Pvt.) Limited vs SRB
key_issues: Whether Modaraba and Modaraba Management Companies are separate entities.
Whether remuneration constitutes taxable management services.
Whether the services fall under taxable tariff heading 9824.0000.
Whether tax liability arises from remuneration received from profit earned.

key_findings.modaraba_and_management_company: Separate legal entities with distinct rights and liabilities.
key_findings.nature_of_service: Management services including fund and asset management.
key_findings.taxability: Remuneration received is taxable under tariff heading 9824.0000.

penalties.default_surcharge: Under section 44 of the Sindh Sales Tax on Services Act, 2011.

maxims.quid_pro_quo: Exchange of goods or services contingent upon mutual consideration.

words_and_phrases.management: To exercise executive, administrative, and supervisory powers.
words_and_phrases.service: Anything which is not goods and involves providing of non-goods.

summary_vector_notes: The case revolves around the taxation of management services provided by Modaraba Management Companies under Sindh Sales Tax on Services Act, 2011. The court upheld the taxability of these services and dismissed the appeal.
